qa_list.question: When will applications for the MCDS program open?
qa_list.answer: Applications for the MCDS program will open on September 6, 2023.

qa_list.question: What is the final application deadline for fall admission to the MCDS program?
qa_list.answer: The final application deadline for fall admission to the MCDS program is Wednesday, December 13, 2023.

qa_list.question: What happens if an application for the MCDS program is incomplete?
qa_list.answer: Incomplete applications will not be considered.

qa_list.question: Where should applicants go to apply for the MCDS program?
qa_list.answer: Applicants should go to the SCS online application to apply for the MCDS program.

qa_list.question: What is the cost of applying to the MCDS program by the early deadline?
qa_list.answer: $80 per program

qa_list.question: When is the final deadline for applying to the MCDS program?
qa_list.answer: The final deadline for applying to the MCDS program is Wednesday, December 13, 2023.

qa_list.question: What happens if an application for the MCDS program is submitted after the early deadline?
qa_list.answer: $100 per program

qa_list.question: Do applicants need to submit GRE scores when applying to the MCDS program?
qa_list.answer: Yes, GRE scores are required.

qa_list.question: Are GRE scores waived for students who have graduated from or are enrolled at Carnegie Mellon?
qa_list.answer: Yes, GRE scores are waived for applicants who have graduated from, or are enrolled at, Carnegie Mellon.

qa_list.question: What is the maximum age of a valid GRE score when applying to the MCDS program?
qa_list.answer: GRE scores will NOT be accepted if they are more than five years old.

qa_list.question: What is required for applicants who want to apply at Carnegie Mellon?
qa_list.answer: GRE scores are required, but waived for those who have graduated from or are enrolled at Carnegie Mellon. GRE scores more than five years old will not be accepted.

qa_list.question: Is the GRE At Home test acceptable?
qa_list.answer: Yes, it is accepted but they prefer applicants to take the GRE at a test center if possible.

qa_list.question: What kind of English proficiency tests are required for F-1 or J-1 visa holders?
qa_list.answer: Applicants who will be studying on an F-1 or J-1 visa, and whose native language is not English, must demonstrate their English proficiency via TOEFL (preferred), IELTS, or Duolingo.

qa_list.question: Why do they discourage the use of 'TOEFL ITP Plus for China'?
qa_list.answer: They discourage it because speaking is not scored in this test.

qa_list.question: Do they issue waivers based on previous study at a U.S. high school, college or university?
qa_list.answer: No, they do not issue waivers for non-native speakers of English based on previous study at a U.S. high school, college, or university.

qa_list.question: Do they issue waivers based on previous study at an English-language high school, college, or university outside the United States?
qa_list.answer: No, they do not issue waivers for non-native speakers of English based on previous study at an English-language high school, college, or university outside the U.S.

qa_list.question: Do applicants applying to MCDS need to submit scores from an English proficiency exam taken within the last two years?
qa_list.answer: Yes, they are required to submit scores from an English proficiency exam taken within the last two years.

qa_list.question: What happens if applicants have GRE scores more than five years old?
qa_list.answer: GRE scores more than five years old will not be accepted.

qa_list.question: Is the 'TOEFL ITP Plus for China' test acceptable for English proficiency evaluation at MCDS?
qa_list.answer: No, they discourage its use because speaking is not scored in this test.

qa_list.question: What are the minimum scores required for successful applicants?
qa_list.answer: Successful applicants must have a minimum TOEFL score of 100 (Reading, Listening, Speaking, Writing scores all 25 or above), IELTS score of 7.5 (Reading 7 or above, Listening 7 or above, Speaking 7.5 or above, Writing 6.5 or above), or DuoLingo score of 120 (Literacy 115 or above, Comprehension 125 or above, Production 100 or above, Conversation 105 or above).

qa_list.question: What is the minimum total iBT score for a successful applicant?
qa_list.answer: A successful applicant will normally have a total iBT score of at least 100.

qa_list.question: Is it mandatory to submit a video about yourself and your interest in the MCDS program?
qa_list.answer: No, submitting a short (1-3 minutes) video is not mandatory but strongly suggested.

qa_list.question: Do you need to upload official transcripts from each university attended at the time of application submission?
qa_list.answer: Yes, all electronic transcripts should be uploaded by the time you submit your application. If they are not uploaded by December 13, you will not have access to upload them and your application may not be considered.

qa_list.question: What happens if test scores or official transcripts are not marked as received until after the submission of the application?
qa_list.answer: If electronic transcripts and test scores are not marked as received until you submit and pay the application fee, it may take several days or weeks to check the uploaded material. Therefore, please allow time.

qa_list.question: Do you need to mail hard versions of your official transcripts at the time of application?
qa_list.answer: No, we do not require mailed, hard versions of transcripts at the time of application. If you are accepted to the program, you will be given instructions to then mail them.

qa_list.question: What should be included in your resume for MCDS application?
qa_list.answer: Your resume should outline your education, research experience, work experience, publication, scholarships, prizes and honors received, society memberships.

qa_list.question: What happens if test scores or official transcripts are not uploaded by December 13?
qa_list.answer: If they are NOT uploaded by December 13, you will not have access to upload them and your application may not be considered for review.

qa_list.question: What should the video submitted as part of the MCDS application include?
qa_list.answer: The short (1-3 minutes) video should tell us about you and why you are interested in the MCDS program.

qa_list.question: What are the three main components of a successful graduate school application according to this text?
qa_list.answer: The three main components of a successful graduate school application, as per the given text, are resume submission, statement of purpose preparation, and securing three letters of recommendation.

qa_list.question: What is the deadline for submitting letters of recommendation according to this text?
qa_list.answer: The deadline for submitting letters of recommendation as per the given text is December 13th.

qa_list.question: Where should applicants check if their application and supporting documents are complete before the final deadline?
qa_list.answer: Applicants need to check their submitted applications for completeness before the final deadline, as per the given text.

qa_list.question: What is the contact information provided in this text for further details about application procedures?
qa_list.answer: The contact information provided in the text for more details regarding application procedures is Master of Computational Data Science at 5000 Forbes Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA 15213-3891, phone number: 412-268-9870 and email address: ltiwebmaster@cs.cmu.edu.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of a statement of purpose according to this text?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of a statement of purpose, as per the given text, is to describe your primary areas of interest in research, related experiences, and objective in pursuing a graduate degree at Carnegie Mellon.

qa_list.question: What should applicants do if their application is incomplete?
qa_list.answer: If an applicant's application is found to be incomplete, they need to make certain that it is complete before the final deadline as per the given text.

qa_list.question: Who are recommended to write letters of recommendation according to this text?
qa_list.answer: According to the text, at least two out of three letters of recommendation should be from faculty or recent employers.

qa_list.question: What is the responsibility of applicants regarding their application and supporting documents before the final deadline according to this text?
qa_list.answer: Applicants are responsible for ensuring that their applications, supporting documents, and letters of recommendation are uploaded by the final deadline as per the given text.

qa_list.question: What is the location of Master of Computational Data Science according to this text?
qa_list.answer: The location of Master of Computational Data Science, as mentioned in the text, is 5000 Forbes Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA 15213-3891.

Apply to the MCDS Program

How To Apply

The School of Computer Science has a centralized online application process for graduate admissions. Applications for the MCDS program will open on September 6, 2023.

All supporting documentation for fall admission must be received by the final application deadline of Wednesday, December 13, 2023. Incomplete applications will not be considered.

To apply, go to the SCS online application .

In order to compare MCDS to other professional masters programs at CMU please refer here:

https://www.cs.cmu.edu/sites/default/files/SCS_Masters_Programs_in_Brief...

Important Deadlines

Early Deadline: Wednesday, November 29, 2023 (3pm EST)

Final Deadline: Wednesday, December 13, 2023 (3pm EST)

Costs

By the early deadline: $80 per program, By final deadline: $100 per program.

Requirements

Requirements

Students should report raw university GPA scores and NOT converted scores. Please DO NOT convert your international score to a US GPA or weighted GPA or other system.

GRE scores are required. GRE scores are waived for applicants who have graduated from, or are enrolled at, Carnegie Mellon. GRE scores will NOT be accepted if they are more than five years old. Our Institution Code is 2074; Department Code is 0402. More information is available on the program website .

The GRE At Home test is accepted but we prefer you take the GRE at a test center if possible.

Proof of English Language Proficiency: If you will be studying on an F-1 or J-1 visa, and English is not a native language for you (native language…meaning spoken at home and from birth), we are required to formally evaluate your English proficiency. We require applicants who will be studying on an F-1 or J-1 visa, and for whom English is not a native language, to demonstrate English proficiency via one of these standardized tests: TOEFL (preferred), IELTS, or Duolingo. We discourage the use of the "TOEFL ITP Plus for China," since speaking is not scored. We do not issue waivers for non-native speakers of English. In particular, we do not issue waivers based on previous study at a U.S. high school, college, or university. We also do not issue waivers based on previous study at an English-language high school, college, or university outside of the United States. No amount of educational experience in English, regardless of which country it occurred in, will result in a test waiver. Applicants applying to MCDS are required to submit scores from an English proficiency exam taken within the last two years. Scores taken before Sept. 1, 2021, will not be accepted regardless of whether you have previously studied in the U.S.

Successful applicants will have a minimum TOEFL score of 100 (Reading, Listening, Speaking, Writing scores all 25 or above), IELTS score of 7.5 (Reading 7 or above, Listening 7 or above, Speaking 7.5 or above, Writing 6.5 or above), or DuoLingo score of 120 (Literacy 115 or above, Comprehension 125 or above, Production 100 or above, Conversation 105 or above).

Please send scores via ETS using our SCS/CMU codes:

TOEFL Institution Code: 4256

TOEFL Department Code: 78

A successful applicant will normally have a total iBT score of at least 100.

Test Scores: All test scores must be uploaded (as PDF) to your application. If they are NOT uploaded by December 13, you will not have access to upload them and your application may not be considered for review.

A short (1-3 minutes) video of yourself. Tell us about you and why you are interested in the MCDS program. This is not a required part of the application process, but it is STRONGLY suggested.

Official transcripts from each university you have attended, regardless of whether you received your degree there. We do NOT require mailed, hard versions of transcripts at the time of application. Do not mail your transscripts to the admission office. If you are accepted to the program, you will be given instructions to then mail them. All electronic transcripts should be uploaded by the time you submit your application. If they are not uploaded by December 13, you will not have access to upload them and your application may not be considered. **NOTE** Electronic transcripts and test scores are not marked as received until you submit and pay the application fee. It may take several days or weeks to check the uploaded material, so please allow time.

Resume , please submit your current resume, outline your education, research experience, work experience, publication, scholarships, prizes and honors received, society memberships.

Statement of Purpose , prepare a consise one or two page essay that describes your primary areas of interest in research, your related experiences, and your objective in pursuing a graduate degree at Carnegie Mellon

Three letters of recommendation , recommenders should know you relatively well and be able to evaluate the quality of your previous work. At least two should be from faculty or recent employers. With the on-line application, letters will be requested and submitted electronically. Paper recommendations will NOT be accepted. Letters of recommendation are due by December 13. All deadlines are FINAL. Letters received after this date may not be considered in the review of your application.

It is your responsibility to make certain that your application, supporting documents, and letters of recommendation are uploaded to your application by the final deadline. You may check your submitted application to make certain that it is complete.

For more details regarding application, please see the SCS Master's Admissions page . No incomplete applications will be eligible for consideration.

Contact Us Master of Computational Data Science

5000 Forbes Avenue

Pittsburgh, PA

15213-3891

412-268-9870

ltiwebmaster@cs.cmu.edu
